title: Engineering Mechanics: Statics and Dynamics 12th c2010 Hibbeler
description:
For students in these parts of the world where the 12th edition is still in use (current edition: 13th) and for those who studied with a hard copy of the 12th edition and would like to have a digital copy for "their records":

Engineering Mechanics: Statics and Dynamics, 12th COMBINED Edition (c2010), textbook by Russell Charles Hibbeler.

TEXTBOOK INFO: <a href=" http://www.pearsonhighered.com/educator/product/Engineering-Mechanics-Combined-Statics-Dynamics/9780138149291.page" rel="nofollow" target="_NEW"> http://www.pearsonhighered.com/educator/product/Engineering-Mechanics-Combined-Statics-Dynamics/9780138149291.page</a>
(Units: Mixed types - US & SI)

Contents:
---------
STATICS
 1. General Principles
 2. Force Vectors
 3. Equilibrium of a Particle
 4. Force System
 5. Equilibrium of a Rigid Body
 6. Structural Analysis
 7. Internal Forces
 8. Friction
 9. Center of Gravity and Centroid
 10. Moments of Inertia
 11. Virtual Work
DYNAMICS
 12. Kinematics of a Particle
 13. Kinetics of a Particle: Force and Acceleration
 14. Kinetics of a Particle: Work and Energy
 15. Kinetics of a Particle: Impulse and Momentum
 16. Planar Kinematics of a Rigid Body
 17. Planar Kinetics of a Rigid Body: Force and Acceleration
 18. Planar Kinetics of aRigid Body: Work and Energy
 19. Planar Kinetics of a RigidBody: Impulse and Momentum
 20. Three-Dimensional Kinematics of a Rigid Body
 21. Three-Dimensional Kinetics of a Rigid Body
 22. Vibrations
(detailed contents at website above)

FILE INFO: paginated, bookmarked, true PDF (single file; 125 MB).
compressed (zipped): *right-click* the filename (.7z) & choose *Extract* to convert to PDF; discard the .7z file (container) when done with seeding.
